revised_title: Invention for Safely Illuminating Explosive Mixtures of Fire-Damp in Coal Mines
tldr: Humphry Davy invented a wire gauze-covered lamp that safely consumes fire-damp gas in coal mines, providing light without causing explosions. The lamp can be used in explosive mixtures of fire-damp and air, as the wire gauze prevents the flame from igniting the surrounding gas. This invention significantly improves safety for coal miners working in hazardous environments.
